titles.title: To amend the compensation program established under the Air Transportation Safety and System Stabilization Act to clarify that, in reducing the amount of compensation provided to a person under the program by amounts received from collateral sources, collateral sources do not include charitable sources.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration and Claims.

bill.summary: 11/29/2001--Introduced. Amends the Air Transportation Safety and System Stabilization Act to state that amounts received from charitable sources shall not be used as a collateral source for purposes of reducing the amount of compensation provided under the September 11th Victim Compensation Fund of 2001 to an individual (or relatives of a deceased individual) who was physically injured or killed as a result of the terrorist-related aircraft crashes of September 11, 2001.
